name: Angeline
CustomerReview: There’s no doubt the Audi Q3 has been inspired by the vast Q8 SUV – that giant grille, for example, makes it look just like a toddler that’s trying on its Grandparent’s dentures

name: Rodgers
CustomerReview: With plenty of kit on board, like the larger touchscreen and keyless go, Allure Premium is the trim to have

name: Mcconnell
CustomerReview: Even in the company of many swanky small SUVs, the Range Rover Evoque is one of the most stylish. And, it comes with some seriously impressive in-car tech, too.

name: Reed
CustomerReview: I’d be inclined to go for one of the A 250 models. Not only do you get a punchier engine than cheaper ones, you get a more sophisticated suspension set-up too.

name: Willa
CustomerReview: The Volvo XC40 is a bit of a cracker. It's a sophisticated SUV with an upmarket feel and the icing on the cake is that it's really easy to live with.

name: Marquez
CustomerReview: Our pick of the range is the 1.5 petrol in R-Line trim. It's a great engine for all types of driving, and R-Line goodies makes the Tiguan look its best.
